# Draft:Gettysburg Beyond the Battle Museum

Gettysburg Beyond the Battle Museum is a nonprofit history museum located in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania. Operated by Gettysburg History, a project of the Adams County Historical Society, the museum opened in 2023 and features exhibits on the history of Gettysburg and Adams County, with a focus on the civilian experience during the Battle of Gettysburg.
History
The Adams County Historical Society announced plans for the museum in 2022 and began construction the same year. The museum officially opened to the public on April 15, 2023. The opening featured participation from filmmaker Ken Burns, who has supported the institution publicly.
The museum was developed to house the historical society’s collections, which include documents, photographs, and artifacts related to local and national history.
Exhibits
The museum includes permanent exhibits covering regional history from prehistory through the 20th century. Topics include geology, Native American settlement, colonial and Revolutionary-era Gettysburg, the 1863 battle, the aftermath, and the town’s postwar evolution.
One exhibit, titled Caught in the Crossfire, is a 360-degree immersive presentation that simulates the experience of civilians during the Battle of Gettysburg. Visitors stand inside a replica 1860s home while visual and audio effects recreate battle conditions.
Artifacts on display include battle-damaged objects, personal items belonging to residents, and primary source documents. The museum also features exhibits on Abraham Lincoln's Gettysburg Address and postwar memory.
Reception
The museum has been featured in national and regional media, including The Washington Post, National Geographic, and WGAL-TV. It was voted best new museum in the country in 2023 through USA Today’s 10Best Readers’ Choice Awards.
Organization
Beyond the Battle Museum is operated by Gettysburg History, the public-facing brand of the Adams County Historical Society. The organization also manages the Shriver House Museum and the Gettysburg Film Festival.
